summary: Delete the entire BLZ cache (all sources, indices, and metadata). Use sparingly—most workflows should prefer `blz remove <alias>`.

usage.description: Interactive wipe. Prompts for confirmation before deleting files.
Skip the confirmation prompt. Recommended only for scripted resets or CI.

effects: Deletes every source directory under the BLZ data path (llms.txt, llms.json, indices, archives).
Removes per-source descriptors and registry state (data.json) so aliases/tags must be reintroduced.
Does not touch global configuration files outside the cache.
agent_guidance: Call `blz list --json` beforehand and persist any metadata you need to restore.
Immediately follow with manifest-driven `blz add` or `blz update --all` to repopulate key sources.
Use `./hydrate-dev.sh --force` instead when you only need to clone production data into the dev profile.
